channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ronald Reagan Presidential Foundation Director: Civility can be your edge in this polarized time, when people have forgotten how to coexist
item.description: In a fractured world, the office has become an unexpected civic incubator. And civility is good for the bottom line, not just for democracy and work r...

item.title: Steal This Brand’s Playbook for Revenue-Driving Events
item.description: In 2024, the women’s workwear brand M.M. LaFleur convinced more than 4,000 people to come out in-person, most of whom were new customers.

item.title: Exclusive: Climate-tech startup Brineworks raises $5.5 million
item.description: The Amsterdam-based company is eyeing a market-ready product by the end of next year.

item.title: House prepares to vote on a funding bill to avert government shutdown
item.description: Republican and Democratic lawmakers show no signs of budging as the House takes up a bill Friday to avert a partial government shutdown in less than t...

item.title: Nvidia and the U.S. Government Both Have Stakes in Intel Now
item.description: Intel stock surged after announcing a $5 billion deal with Nvidia.

item.title: SoftBank is preparing for global layoffs to its Vision Fund team, in a pivot to AI
item.description: SoftBank Group will lay off nearly 20% of its Vision Fund team globally as it shifts resources to founder Masayoshi Son’s large-scale artificial intel...

item.title: Developing This Leadership Skill Will Give Your Brand an Advantage
item.description: In today’s ‘attention economy,’ business leaders need to stand out to succeed. These four books show the way.

item.title: Surviving the Great Flattening: The coming extinction of the middle manager
item.description: For a century, firms built moats around knowledge, the exact layer of experts in the middle that is now being thinned from the herd.

item.title: Workday CFO on why $1.1 billion Sana deal aligns with M&A strategy
item.description: Much of the anticipated success comes from cultural fit, Zane Rowe said.

item.title: How late-night’s Colbert and Stewart are responding to Jimmy Kimmel’s suspension
item.description: Jon Stewart , Stephen Colbert and Jimmy Fallon opened their late-night shows Thursday using a mix of humor and solidarity with suspended ABC host Jimm...

item.title: Fish recalled nationwide over Listeria fears, including smoked salmon and sea bass: Full list of products to avoid
item.description: Haifa Smoked Fish, a seafood smokehouse facility based in Jamaica, Queens, has issued a recall after the discovery of Listeria monocytogenes in its co...

item.title: Commercial real estate’s seismic transformation is creating new winners—and losers— in the property market
item.description: Is the office market in freefall? It depends on who you ask.

item.title: Trump and China’s Xi Jinping begin talks in a push to seal a TikTok deal
item.description: U.S. President Donald Trump is talking with Chinese leader Xi Jinping on Friday in a push to finalize a deal to allow the popular social media app Tik...

item.title: 5 Brain Implant Companies Developing New Ways to Treat Disease
item.description: These pioneers are aiming to do challenging and important medical work. One has already implanted 54 patients.

item.title: Science Says Stop Asking ‘Will This Make Me Happy?’ and Start Asking Yourself This Instead
item.description: Predicting whether the outcome of a decision will make you happy is often impossible. Predicting a decision’s impact on you is not.
